artist: Artist: Jean Le Pautre; Engraver: François Chauneau
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
portfolio: From From André Félibien's "Les Divertissemens de Versailles donnez par la Roy a toute sa cour au retour de la conqueste de la France-Comté en l'année M.DC.LXXIV," Imprimerie Royale, Paris, 1676
text: This musical concert was performed in the gardens at Trianon, Louis XIV's private retreat on the grounds of Versailles, named after the village the king demolished to build his smaller residence here. The Trianon gardens were famous for their opulence, with the flowerbeds reportedly changed daily and filled with a diverse assortment of fresh scented flowers.
title: The Fête of 1674, Second Day: Musical Concert in the Garden of Trianon
